NewsDetail.Name: Orientation and Workshops for Site Authors
NewsDetail.Title: Orientation and Workshops for Site Authors
NewsDetail.Abstract: An orientation for web site authors will be held May 9th, with workshops on the 10th and 12th.
NewsDetail.Author: Jeffrey Dunster
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
The BYU-Idaho Web Builder Support Team is sponsoring a Web Builder orientation for any interested faculty, staff and students. This orientation will cover the fundamentals of the Web Builder authoring system, its web publishing templates, and where to get more help and training in the weeks ahead. We encourage all potential web authors to attend, though we will record the presentation and provide it to everyone soon thereafter.

When: Monday, May 9th, from 3:15pm to 4:15pm (open Q/A until 5:00pm)

Where: Manwaring Student Center, Special Events room (MC 387)

[The recorded orientation is now available.]

The Web Builder Support Team will also lead open-access workshops to help web authors migrate content from the old Web Editor system and learn the new Web Builder platform.

When: Click here to see upcoming workshop dates and times

Where: McKay 364

Workshop space is limited (about 25 seats). If necessary, preference will be given to those on the first wave of the official migration schedule.

Please note that the All-employee meeting on May 12th will overlap with the first hour of the workshop. We are keeping that hour open for student employees to get assistance, if needed. The student portion of our support team will be staffing all the workshops anyway.

 

Orientation Agenda

3:15 - Introduction and Prayer

3:20 - Beta Campaign Goals

Refine the design and functionality

Migrate content from old sites (wave schedule)

3:30 - Overview of Content Management Concepts

Separation of content from presentation

Content re-usability (an elusive myth)

Workflow

The missing pieces: social networking, media management, and more

3:40 - Web Builder Community

Email List

Reference Guide

Help Desk

Web Builder Support Team

4:00 - What Next?

Keeping pace with a rapidly changing Internet
